lexUnit.name: expanse.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a wide continuous area of something, typically land or sea.

sentence.text: North of the Arctic Circle Norway has some fine mountainous country and Finnmark , an expanse of flatter tundra that offers a very different and , in winter , a very cold trip .
Sure enough , at the top , when he had found his way through a screen of brambles , he could see the tumbledown shed across an expanse of gardens .
The curtains were of heavy velvet , but seemed somewhat skimpy for the expanse of window .
Now it was late afternoon and the headland lay enriched by the mellow afternoon light , the sea a wide expanse of wrinkled blue with a painter 's stroke of purple laid on the horizon .
What had looked like a smooth expanse of grey-green wood was , close to , a maze of rough bark , roots and clumps of moss .
Occasionally I saw birds , huge buzzards , squatting on rock outcrops , and once a small antelope , far off across an expanse of stones .
The expanse of beach was so denuded of any trace of the present century we might have stepped out on to a distant planet .
Near by is a quay , at the side of an estuary , and here the scenery becomes melancholy and fiat ; expanses of mud , saltish commons , the marsh-birds crying .
Before boarding , Elisabeth stood on the harbour wall , gazed out on the wrinkled asphalt expanse and took note of the spume that rose , here and there , from unsettled waves .
Lochan Fada , Fionn Loch and a score of other water expanses , jewels in sunlight , sullen under cloud , are rarely seen .
Fergus was staring at the plasterboard expanse above them .
Long expanses of sandy beach fringe the clear turquoise sea .
This is the face of mean Nineties Britain , multi-storey car parks and flats flanking a wide , featureless expanse of road with orange streetlamps brightening the gloom .
There were many examples of species occupying territories separated by wide expanses of ocean , and in the 1850s it became fashionable to invoke prehistoric land-bridges to explain the migrations .

At last , a streak of orange light appeared to the east ; and gradually the white sea in front of them became an immense expanse of fertile green , while the purple ocean behind turned shimmering white .
I look out across the twinkling expanse of ocean , and decide to go and see Teddy .
The house sits snugly , 275 feet above sea level , with a view southwards out over a wide expanse of undulating country to hills beyond .
They had pulled the rails up and there was an expanse of cindery ground suitable for a school .
Monsignor Delgard turned to the congregation , his large hands resting on either side of the lectern , eyes looking into the expanse of expectant faces rather than the missal before him .
The wind showed no signs of abating , but the tide was out and the inner basin was an expanse of fine , yellow sand .
Lissa wandered over to the window and gazed out over the expanse of carefully tended shrubbery that bordered the car park .
As a prairie youth I loved Vancouver and the great expanse of open sea , and hoped to live there some day .
She had been so engrossed in Martha 's life that it had not even crossed her mind that she ( Maxine ) should be frightened of that great expanse of water .
To the North there are great expanses of beaches .
In the the great expanse of desert these three , the road , the railway , the telegraph poles , were inseparable .
The great expanse of pond was ahead , still solid and unrippled under the deblemishing moonlight .
There stretched before him a great expanse of mud-trodden grass , gleaming brokenly like water viewed from a height in the summer sun .
He seldom hunts in Gloucestershire because he finds the large expanses of flat and open farmland boring .
The far wall was a large expanse of ornamented glass , with pitch blackness beyond .
Environmentalists , however , are concerned about the effect that the plant will have on the immediate area , the nation 's last large scale expanse of lowland tropical forest .
For example , Clarke scorns those who argue that mankind will not eventually move out to colonise the vast expanses of space .
Perdita looked at the huge puddles reflecting a vast expanse of sky .
A short walk takes you down to Widemouth Beach one of Cornwall 's finest beaches with a vast expanse of sand , good bathing and wonderful surfing .
Their bedroom was in the front of the house and looked out over the sea , a vast expanse of blue , sparkling in early morning sunshine .
It was indeed a bay , a vast expanse of ribbed brown sand over which the water was just beginning to creep , a gleaming line on the outer edge .
From the seafront up to a mile inland was an uninterrupted expanse of tall grass and fern , the delight of ramblers .
My father and mother stand nearer to the babies than I and the whole ensemble is posed on an interminable expanse of medium-cut grass .
There was something about this huge expanse of rugged land that changed his sense of time .
Huge expanses of fertile land and unlimited supplies of water give it enormous productive potential .
Like any wide expanse of sea , the Pacific Ocean is criss-crossed with commercial air-routes .
But for the many guests who lie basking in the sun , around the pool or on the Club 's beach , the most familiar view is the endless expanse of brilliant blue sky .
She swept her hand towards the endless expanse of ice and water .
Lucenzo cast off , heading the boat towards a lovely little island ahead , set in an expanse of flat water , shining like a silver sheet in the weak sun breaking through the mist .
